item.description:
Many of us know this ride all too well and every bit of it has it's own delights. Just getting out of the city and the all too familiar roads we ride all the time will be a relief.

This is typically an all day ride with lots of stops totaling about 300 miles. Late August and September are by far the best times to ride though the nights are getting cooler the dryer air and smells of late summer make sunny day rides a real treat.

We will be taking Rt 2 & 119 out to Brattleboro for Mac & Cheese at the country Deli and then Rt 8 south out of Wilmington southwest to North Adams and up the mountain.. then down the other side, across the state line into NY and south - from there we will take the pike back home or make our way back through Northwest CT into Mass again and home.

Dress in Layers as it will be cool in the AM and PM and comfort is key.

The overall route may change based on group consensus when we have lunch and look at the weather and time before sunset etc.. 

Hope the stars align and I see a few of you out there!

 

Paul
item.how_to_find_us: Look for scooters and dudes with helmets :)
item.name: Mt Greylock!
